apt-get excepts other strings than "Y" as confirmation. E.g. "Yn". It shouldn't do that.
I suspect it is only Reading the first character for the confirmation.
if you do Ny does it have the expected behavior?
Of course not. It installs the unwanted software
that will prepare the bug report and then you can add details to it after it opens the browser

Reading your question again. My answer is the opposite: apt-get with Ny *will* cancel the install as expected. Playing around with apt-get for a while now, it seems accepting Y* is a feature and not a bug. Thanks for helping!
